Arcane.title: Arcane
Arcane.synopsis: Amid the stark discord of twin cities Piltover and Zaun, two sisters fight on rival sides of a war between magic technologies and clashing convictions.
Arcane.review: Oh my god, amazing. Who would've thought League of Legends would've provided the lore for one of the best animated shows to ever exist. Or just shows in general. Redefined TV for me, some of the greatest implementations of 'show not tell' in recent TV, and with the abundance of spoon-feeding streaming shows, this was such a gem. Needless to say that it has impeccable animation, and such a creative approach to characterization that it almost made me re-install Maya. Great character development, and deterioration when called for - perfection.

The Bear.title: The Bear
The Bear.synopsis: Carmen Berzatto, a brilliant young chef from the fine-dining world is forced to return home to run his local family sandwich shop - the Original Beef of Chicagoland - after a heartbreaking death in his family. A world away from what he's used to, Carmy must balance the soul-crushing reality of trading in Michelin star restaurants for the small 'business' kitchen filled with strong-willed and obstinate staff and his strained familial relationships, all while grappling with the impact of his brother's suicide.
The Bear.review: My favorite show in recent times. I came across it randomly in my 2nd year of university and the sincere approach to a chef's storyline and film-level cinematography captivated me. I've rewatched it like 2 times now and that fishes episode still hits the same.

Bottoms.title: Bottoms
Bottoms.synopsis: Unpopular best friends PJ and Josie start a high school fight club to meet girls and lose their virginity. They soon find themselves in over their heads when the most popular students start beating each other up in the name of self-defense.
Bottoms.review: One of the funniest, if not THE funniest movie I've ever seen. And I waited a long time for this to come out #beenheresincethestart. Love Rachel Sennot, Emma Seligman, Ayo Edebiri, I'll eat up anything they'll make, direct, produce or star in!! From Shiva Baby to Bottoms, what a track record. There are some imperfections and ADR-annoyances but what the movie lacks in perfect editing it more than makes up in needle drops.

Bones and All.title: Bones and All
Bones and All.synopsis: Love blossoms between a young woman on the margins of society and a disenfranchised drifter as they embark on a 3,000-mile odyssey through the backroads of America. However, despite their best efforts, all roads lead back to their terrifying pasts and a final stand that will determine whether their love can survive their differences.
Bones and All.review: Although the tale of a gruesome couple, unravelling Maren and Lee's story (and their victims) does more damage to the heart than the stomach. A beautiful coming-of-age love story with even more beautiful cinematography accompanied by the most beautiful couple. Grossly lacking Ethel Cain in the score though.

I Saw the TV Glow.title: I Saw the TV Glow
I Saw the TV Glow.synopsis: Teenager Owen is just trying to make it through life in the suburbs when his classmate Maddy introduces him to a mysterious late-night TV show — a vision of a supernatural world beneath their own. In the pale glow of the television, Owen’s view of reality begins to crack.
I Saw the TV Glow.review: Beautiful cinematography. Insanely immersive, one of those movies that you need to sit with and listen to the soundtrack for a day or two.... or a week or two... I think it's almost been a month.  Just rewatched it... one of the few movies I genuinely think I could sit and write pages and pages of dicussion and analysis on.

Avatar: The Last Airbender.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender
Avatar: The Last Airbender.synopsis: Four elemental nations are at war with each other and only the Avatar, master of all four elements, can restore peace. The new Avatar comes in the form of Aang who strives to fulfil his destiny.
Avatar: The Last Airbender.review: One of the OGs. So so ahead of its time, will never get sick of the world and lore of Avatar. No live action or ATLA rip off can ever replicate what they did with this one! Mandatory viewing for my future children for sure.

Alice in Borderland.title: Alice in Borderland
Alice in Borderland.synopsis: Obsessed gamer Arisu suddenly finds himself in a strange, emptied-out version of Tokyo in which he and his friends must compete in dangerous games in order to survive.
Alice in Borderland.review: Heavily underrated show. I've been rewatching it recently and both the pacing and direction is quite original. I think it does fit the show well. I'm stoked to rediscover the lore of the games depending on their suit.

Yellowjackets.title: Yellowjackets
Yellowjackets.synopsis: A team of girls' soccer players travelling to Seattle face a tragedy when their plane crashes in the Ontario wilderness. While they struggle to survive the harsh conditions, their sanity slips away.
Yellowjackets.review: Really good for a cable show. They do the time switching and having you care for both the younger and older versions of the characters pretty well. It helps that the acting and casting is amazing, and most characters are incredibly interesting.

The Walking Dead.title: The Walking Dead
The Walking Dead.synopsis: In the wake of a zombie apocalypse, various survivors struggle to stay alive. As they search for safety and evade the undead, they are forced to grapple with rival groups and difficult choices.
The Walking Dead.review: Incredible. How does it not even get remotely uninteresting or not hit the same after SO many seasons?? Currently on season seven, grieving Glenn </3

Little Fires Everywhere.title: Little Fires Everywhere
Little Fires Everywhere.synopsis: Based on Celeste Ng's 2017 bestseller, 'Little Fires Everywhere' follows the intertwined fates of the picture-perfect Richardson family and the enigmatic mother and daughter who upend their lives.
Little Fires Everywhere.review: Interesting class, race, intersectionality discussions; and at the end of the day a deeply complex portrayal of familial relationships. Wish I had read the book beforehand, it's so obvious from its rich subtext and characterization that it's an adaptation.

Abbott Elementary.title: Abbott Elementary
Abbott Elementary.synopsis: A workplace comedy centered on a group of dedicated teachers - and an oblivious principal - in a Philadelphia public school where, despite the odds stacked against them, they are determined to help their students succeed in life.
Abbott Elementary.review: One of the funniest, and definitely the most wholesome sitcoms I've ever seen! Still makes me EL-Oh-EL after 4 seasons. Janine and Gregory's romance will go down in sit(rom)com history :') and NO Janine hate will not be tolerated! Unless you're Ava. Or Barbara... or Melissa... or her sister played by Ayo Edebiri (please come back).

It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia.title: It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia
It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia.synopsis: In Philadelphia, five toxically co-dependent and selfishly motivated w̶h̶i̶t̶e̶ t̶r̶a̶s̶h̶ friends run a decrepit Irish bar that bears witness to all kinds of trickery.
It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia.review: Error 404. Not found. For ANY records, I do not enjoy this show.

Ratatouille.title: Ratatouille
Ratatouille.synopsis: Remy, a resident of Paris, appreciates good food and has quite a sophisticated palate. He would love to become a chef so he can create and enjoy culinary masterpieces to his heart's delight. The only problem is, Remy is a rat. When he winds up in the sewer beneath one of Paris' finest restaurants, the rodent gourmet finds himself ideally placed to realize his dream.
Ratatouille.review: My favorite Pixar/Disney/Children's/(ANIMATION EVEN..?) movie by far. The iconic strawberry & cheese scene single-rat-handedly changed the way I eat and enjoy food.

Zola.title: Zola
Zola.synopsis: 'Y'all wanna hear a story about why me & this bitch here fell out? It's kind of long but full of suspense.' Thus began the odyssey of one A'Ziah King, aka Zola. Zola's stranger than fiction saga, which she first told in a now iconic series of viral, uproarious tweets, comes to dazzling cinematic life.
Zola.review: Inspired by The Twitter thread ever, and it shows. Beautiful exploration of social media as a vehicle of storytelling and as the lens through which we originally got to learn of this story. Acting, comedic timing and editing also DELIVERED. The editing was so good it got me stalking the editor! Wow!! Eurphoria and Anora taste like reheated nachos after finally getting to watch this...
